name: CVE-2013-4397
description: Multiple integer overflows in the th_read function in lib/block.c in libtar before 1.2.20 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code via a long (1) name or (2) link in an archive, which triggers a heap-based buffer overflow.
pattern: [(software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:redhat:enterprise_linux:6.0:*:*:*:*:*:*:*') OR (software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:feep:libtar:1.2.14:*:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:feep:libtar:1.2.17:*:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:feep:libtar:*:*:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:feep:libtar:1.2.13:*:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:feep:libtar:1.2.11:*:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:feep:libtar:1.2.15:*:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:feep:libtar:1.2.18:*:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:feep:libtar:1.2.16:*:*:*:*:*:*:*')]

external_references.description: This object was created using cve2stix from the Signals Corps.
